result.execSummary:
The defendant Ralph E. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 15CF192 but Concurrenty with any other sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain fulltime employment, schooling,or a combination of both and if not then complete 10 hours community service per week.

Participate in any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample already provided.
SOR compliance

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 15CF192 but Concurrent with any other sentence currently serving

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:50 a.m.
**Includes 15CF105, 15CF192 & 15CM219**
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn. Date & time set for Plea Hearing. State notes parties have not done an arraignment in 15CF105 & 15CF192 105
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW. 
State moves to: 15CF192- DRI Ct.2-Possession of THC, DRI Ct.3- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer & DRI Ct.4- Possess Drug Paraphernalia.
                           15CM219- DRI Ct.1- Theft-Movable Property.
COURT GRANTS.
PLEA: 15CF105- Ct.1- Sex Registry Violation (Repeater)>>GUILTY
           15CF192- Ct.1- Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF105- Ct.1- 4 years WI State Prison System, 1 year IC & 3 years ES consecutive to 15CF192. Defendant is not entitled to any credit in 15CF105.
                             15CF192- Ct.1- 3 years WI State Prison System, 1 year IC & 2 years ES consecutive to 15CF105. Defendant is entitled to 98 days credit on 15CF192 only. 
CONDITIONS of ES on both counts: Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week, maintain absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, restitution in the amount of $575.00 to be paid to DOC with 25% of prison wages towards restitution while incarcerated and pay remaining once placed on ES, SOR compliance, defendant has already provided DNA sample, pay CC & DNA surcharge on both files.
Both sentences are consecutive to each other but concurrent to any other sentence currently serving. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.
COURT notes although 15CM219 is DRI, restitution is owed in the amount of $575.00 to be paid to DOC. COURT signs order for restitution.
Defendant is remanded to MCSD to be transported to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 10:08 a.m.
